sectiondef.header: Constructors, destructors, and other standard methods

description.para: Reset method resets all attribute classes

briefdescription.para: Method call for copying child classes.

detaileddescription.para: The method has to be overridden.

briefdescription.para: Virtual reset method.

detaileddescription.para: Needs to be overridden in child classes.

briefdescription.para: Get and set the measure index.

sectiondef.header: Get and set the X drawing relative positions
Check if the measure is the first or last in the system
Set and get the left and right barline types

description.para: This somehow conflicts with AttMeasureLog, which is transferred from and to the Barline object when reading and writing MEI.

See MEIInput::ReadMeasure and MEIOutput::WriteMeasure Alternatively, we could keep them in sync here: data_BARRENDITION GetDrawingLeftBarLine() { m_leftBarLine.SetRend(GetRight()); return m_leftBarLine.GetRend(); } void SetLeftBarLineType(data_BARRENDITION type) { m_leftBarLine.SetRend(type); SetLeft(type); }
Careful - the barlines are owned by the measure and will be destroyed by it.
This method should be used only for acessing them (e.g., when drawing) and not for creating other measure objects.

sectiondef.header: Return the X1 and X2 rel position of the right and left barLine

briefdescription.para: Return and reset the cached width / overflow.

sectiondef.header: Setter and getter of the drawing scoreDef
Setter and getter of the drawing ending
Setter and getter for the flag indicating if there is an AlignmentReference

briefdescription.para: Return the top (first) visible staff in the measure (if any).
Return the bottom (last) visible staff in the measure (if any).
Return the real time offset in milliseconds.
Setter for the time offset.
Setter and getter for the current tempo.
Interface for class functor visitation.
The X absolute position of the measure for facsimile (transcription) encodings.

detaileddescription.para: This is the left and right position of the measure.

sectiondef.header: Cached values of overflow and width for caching the horizontal layout
The measure barlines (left and right) used when drawing

briefdescription.para: The measure aligner that holds the x positions of the content of the measure.
The X relative position of the measure.

detaileddescription.para: It is used internally when calculating the layout and it is not stored in the file.

briefdescription.para: The cached value for m_drawingXRel for caching horizontal layout.
Indicate measured music (CMN), unmeasured (fake measures for mensural or neumes) or neume lines Neume line measure are created from <section type="neon-neume-line">
The unique measure index.
A pointer to the drawing ScoreDef instance.

detaileddescription.para: It is owned by the measure and added to a measure when a scoreDef change before or requires it. This include scoreDef elements before it but also clef changes within the previous measure.

briefdescription.para: A pointer to the ending to which the measure belongs.

detaileddescription.para: Set by PrepareMilestonesFunctor and passed to the System drawing list in DrawMeasure

briefdescription.para: A flag indicating if the measure has AlignmentReference with multiple layers.
Start time state variables.
Overriding CloneReset() method to be called after copy / assignment calls.
Return true if measured music (otherwise we have fake measures)
Return true if the measure represents a neume (section) line.
Methods for adding allowed content.
Specific method for measures.
Return true if the Measure has cached values for the horizontal layout.
Get the X drawing position.
Reset the cached values of the drawingX values.
Return the index position of the measure in its system parent.
Return whether there is mapping of barline values to invisible staves present in measure.
Select drawing barlines based on the previous right and current left barlines (to avoid duplicated doubles or singles).

detaileddescription.para: In certain cases drawn barlines would be simplified if they can be overlapped, e.g. single with dbl

briefdescription.para: Set the drawing barlines for the measure.

detaileddescription.para: Also adjust the right barline of the previous measure and the left one if necessary.

briefdescription.para: Create mapping of original barline values to staves in the measure that are neighbored by invisible staves.

detaileddescription.para: This will allow to draw proper barline when invisible staff hides overlapping barline

briefdescription.para: Return the non-justifiable left margin for the measure.
Return the width of the right barline based on the barline form.
Return the width of the measure, including the barLine width.
Return the inner width of the measure.
Return the center x of the inner of the measure.
Return the right overflow of the control events in the measure.

detaileddescription.para: Takes into account Dir, Dynam, and Tempo.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the section restart shift.
Check if the measure encloses the given time (in millisecond) Return the playing repeat time (1-based), 0 otherwise.
Read only access to m_scoreTimeOffset.
Return vector with tie endpoints for ties that start and end in current measure.
This class represents a measure in a page-based score (Doc).

detaileddescription.para: A Measure is contained in a Staff. It contains Layer objects. For internally simplication of processing, unmeasured music is contained in one single measure object
